docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 24 -- Although Peru and Venezuela have avoided a challenge to their delegations to the regional meeting of the International Labor Organization beginning here tomorrow, by the simple means of not sending any, the issue will...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 24 -- Although Peru and Venezuela have avoided a challenge to their delegations to the regional meeting of the International Labor Organization beginning here tomorrow, by the simple means of not sending any, the issue will come up anyway in the form of a condem natory resolution, it was learned today.

byline.original: By MILTON BRACKERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Pound sterling last week shook off the nervousness which has dominated its market since early month. A strong demand for prompt transfers brought the rate back to $4.03 1/4, a gain of 3/8 cent, while the discounts on 30-90 days' hardened 3/4 to 1 1/2...
docs.lead_paragraph: Pound sterling last week shook off the nervousness which has dominated its market since early month. A strong demand for prompt transfers brought the rate back to $4.03 1/4, a gain of 3/8 cent, while the discounts on 30-90 days' hardened 3/4 to 1 1/2 cents, with six months' narrowed by 1 1/2 cents, with a closing spread of 10 to 11 cents under spot.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended April 22, 1949.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 25 -- The President of Uruguay, Luis Batlle Berres, opened the inter-American regional conference of the International Labor Organization with a plea that social progress should not be sought at the expense of civil...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 25 -- The President of Uruguay, Luis Batlle Berres, opened the inter-American regional conference of the International Labor Organization with a plea that social progress should not be sought at the expense of civil liberties.
docs.abstract: Uruguay Pres Batlle Berres scoring of soc justice without civil liberty seen aimed at Argentina, ILO conf speech

headline.main: CIVIL LIBERTIES PUT FIRST IN AMERICAS; Hemispheric Labor Parley of ILO in Uruguay Hears Plea for Political Freedom

byline.original: By MILTON BRACKERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 26 -- The regional conference of the International Labor Organization went into the committee stage today, with the Bolivian delegate seeking means to raise the question of army control of the Patino tin mines since...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 26 -- The regional conference of the International Labor Organization went into the committee stage today, with the Bolivian delegate seeking means to raise the question of army control of the Patino tin mines since October, 1948. Bolivia has an important Congressional election this Sunday.
docs.abstract: delegates seek to raise question of troops removal from mines, ILO conf, Uruguay

headline.main: BOLIVIAN SEEKS ILO MOVE; Would Raise Question of Army Control of Patino Mines

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 27 -- Venezuela is disposed to invite a mission of the International Labor Organization to study the labor conditions prevailing under the military junta, it was learned today. A resolution condemning alleged violations of...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 27 -- Venezuela is disposed to invite a mission of the International Labor Organization to study the labor conditions prevailing under the military junta, it was learned today. A resolution condemning alleged violations of labor union freedom in Venezuela and Peru is in preparation in the workers' group of the regional ILO conference being held here.

headline.main: ILO GROUP TO STUDY VENEZUELA IS LIKELY

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Norman M. Tucker, new marketing director of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, replied yesterday to Lake Success criticisms of the bank's lending practices by asserting that "one of the strongest" arguments for the bank's...
docs.lead_paragraph: Norman M. Tucker, new marketing director of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, replied yesterday to Lake Success criticisms of the bank's lending practices by asserting that "one of the strongest" arguments for the bank's policy was that "our loans take quite a while."
docs.abstract: dir N M Tucker defends bank and outlines loan plans

headline.main: OFFICIAL DEFENDS WORLD BANK LOANS; N. M. Tucker, New Marketing Director, Cites Slowness in Handling Applications

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, April 30 -Hostility toward private foreign investors on the part of governments in many underdeveloped countries is giving way to increasing eagerness to attract their capital into ambitious projects conceived under the "bold new...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, April 30 -Hostility toward private foreign investors on the part of governments in many underdeveloped countries is giving way to increasing eagerness to attract their capital into ambitious projects conceived under the "bold new program" of President Truman's inaugural address, pledging American technical assistance to economically backward areas throughout the world.

headline.main: ATTITUDE CHANGING ON TRUMAN POINT 4; Hostility Toward Foreign Aid by Underdeveloped Nations Seen Fast Disappearing FOR 'BOLD NEW PROGRAM' U. S. Commitments in Europe Convince Hesitant Countries of Need for Private Help ATTITUDE CHANGING ON TRUMAN POINT 4

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 30 -- Apparent reluctance of Washington to focus the spotlight on violations of democracy within the Hemisphere has been a source of discouragement to the more democratic American nations, such as Uruguay.
